thinking.disposable_income: Westchase residents have relatively high disposable income with a median household income around $65,000, indicating capacity to absorb moderate transportation cost increases.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: The area has significant discretionary spending at retail centers and restaurants, suggesting residents can manage higher sales tax impacts while maintaining quality of life.
thinking.accessibility: Westchase has good road infrastructure and moderate transit access with multiple bus routes, but is primarily car-dependent with 85% of residents commuting by car.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies that maintain reasonable driving costs since most residents are car-dependent. 2) Selected moderate tax rates (1.0%) that can fund transit improvements without excessive burden. 3) Supported modest driver fees ($0.50) to reduce congestion while avoiding major cost increases. 4) Favored lower transit fares to encourage occasional transit use. 5) Balanced travel time improvements with cost impacts given the area's income levels.
